title: [Video 454] Ben Christensen: Don’t Build a Distributed Monolith
Add Barcode Scanning Functionality To Your Ionic App
description:
Being able to scan a barcode is a convenient way to share bits of data. Whether you’re using QR codes to share contact information or traditional barcodes for product information, being able to scan an image is more convenient than either entering a long code or similar.

Previously I wrote about scanning barcodes using Ionic Framework 1, but with Ionic 2 being all the rage I thought it would be worth revisiting for Angular.

The post Add Barcode Scanning Functionality To Your Ionic App appeared first on The Polyglot Developer.

title: Understanding Exit Signals in Erlang/Elixir
description:
“Process linking and how processes send and handle exit signals” - a very important topic to understand in order to build robust apps in Erlang or Elixir, but also the source of a lot of confusions for beginners. In this post, we’ll cover this topic and understand it well, once and for all.
Note: Processes are the same in both Erlang and Elixir, so everything below is equally applicable to both languages.
